content: Yes, the Maya also believed in the importance of their ancestors. They believed that the spirits of their ancestors continued to be present in their daily lives and played an important role as protectors and guides. They also believed in the existence of a spirit world, where their ancestors resided. The Maya conducted ceremonies and rituals to honor their ancestors and seek their guidance and protection. The Maya also built tombs and sarcophagi as a way of honoring and preserving the remains of their deceased family members and leaders.
